academic_standing.gpa_concern: one B+ in English that may/may not affect transcript

key_challenges.quote: One thing that stands out to me about your profile right now is it seems like you're doing like a lot of really cool activities. It does seem like your profile is a little bit cookie cutter right now
She was very, very hesitant about reaching out to the teacher. She had submitted the assignment, but she had to communicate to the teacher
key_challenges.immediate_action: Send email Monday morning for Physics 2

key_challenges.quote: I am on the quieter side, so I don't interact with them a lot. But when I do, generally they like me

key_challenges.challenge: Lack of clear narrative connecting interests
key_challenges.gameplan_quote: Ananyaa has a variety of interests ranging from computer science to chemistry and from dance to chess. However, her story lacks cohesion

key_challenges.parent_quote: She needs to learn to speak more freely... I want her to be a more confident speaker

narrative_development.final_narrative: Student passionate about using technology to solve real-world problems, particularly in environmental sustainability and community empowerment. Problem-solving aptitude (chess, USACO, puzzles) combined with hands-on interests (gardening, karate, food exploration) positions her as someone who bridges analytical thinking with tangible community impact.
narrative_development.how_articulated: Shifted from cookie-cutter profile to diving deeper into gardening/roses, food, reading - combining into something deeper
key_integration_examples: Chemistry + Food interest = Food science pathway
CS + Karate/movement = Robotics research on human movement (UW labs)
Gardening/roses + Community service = Rose garden volunteering/leadership

frameworks_introduced.quote: It does seem like your profile is a little bit cookie cutter right now. Do you know what I mean when I say cookie Cutter
frameworks_introduced.application: Immediately pivoted to exploring unique interests outside school

frameworks_introduced.quote: let's work backwards like Amazon... They are reading your paper... what memories are you leaving them behind
frameworks_introduced.application: Justify rose garden (memorable) over another CS club (forgettable)

frameworks_introduced.quote: the biggest factor is overcoming adversity... has a relative weightage of 4 on 5. Whereas your special talents only have a weightage of 3 on 5
frameworks_introduced.application: Reframed introversion as narrative asset, not deficit

frameworks_introduced.quote: Show your impact. Don't tell... How do you quantify? Your qualitative work is where the challenges you need data points
frameworks_introduced.application: Will be applied in Session 2+ when building projects

frameworks_introduced.quote: we want to maximize like your hours to impact ability... rather like create opportunities, are a good fit for you where you can immediately step into leadership roles
frameworks_introduced.application: Recommended rose garden (immediate leadership) over robotics (long grind)

frameworks_introduced.quote: the only way to win this game is you, be you. UBU... do not try to fake... that is a sure way for you to not stand out
frameworks_introduced.application: Permission to pursue 'weird' interests like gardening

frameworks_introduced.introduced_when: Referenced but not explained (reserved for Session 2)
frameworks_introduced.gameplan_quote: The 1st session will be this 1 68 h framework... We'll say no to 1,000 things

add.rationale: Authentic passion, unique differentiator, community engagement

add.execution: Grow food for shelter/food pantry donation

add.rationale: Technical skills, leadership opportunities, LOR source
add.jenny_reservation: Concerned about fit for introverted student

add.rationale: Combines CS + karate interest, mentorship, suits introverted personality
Combines journalism interest + gardening passion, written expression suits introvert
Bridges chemistry + food interest, unique angle

drop_or_reduce.reason: Not finishing articles, low genuine interest
drop_or_reduce.alternative: Channel writing into blog about authentic passion

drop_or_reduce.reason: Overcrowded, low ROI for time investment

extracurriculars.strategy: Depth over breadth, unique differentiation over prestige, immediate leadership over hierarchy grinding

recommended: Chemistry competitions (building on 'You Be the Chemist' 2nd/3rd place)
Food science competitions (National Geographic, Smithsonian mentioned)
Business competitions (Blue Ocean, Diamond Challenge, Conrad Challenge)
awards.target: Multiple awards in differentiated areas (not just CS)

summer_programs.strategy: Research-focused over large competitive camps (better for introvert)

immediate.action: Email counselor Monday for AP Physics 2 acceleration

recommended: More STEM APs (aligns with CS major intent)
course_rigor.philosophy: Academics not main factor (per Raj), but maintain strong foundation

tactics: Ask teachers about their academic background/research
teacher_relationships.goal: 2-3 teachers for strong LORs by end of junior year

ongoing: Don't assume people will notice work
self_advocacy_practice.goal: Able to advocate without parent intervention

rapport_building: Normalizing struggles (Jenny shared own vitamin D deficiency)
Validation without over-enthusiasm ('That makes sense', 'Yeah, totally')
Personal anecdotes (took martial arts at Stanford)
Not used: Past student success stories (strategic - avoided creating pressure)

probing_techniques.example: Front-end vs algorithms - which do you prefer?
I'm sensing there's something up with it. Why just okay?
Do you like cooking? Eating out? Learning about restaurants? Following chefs?
After asking 'What do you like about chess?' - waited for deeper answer

probing_techniques.when_used: When one door closes, open another

motivation_techniques: Immediate capability affirmation ('You're definitely qualified', 'You already got a 4')
Specific praise over generic ('Congratulations on Bronze qualified' not 'you're so smart')
Small action focus ('Let's start with Monday email')
Timeline reality ('Time is a little short, not too short, since you're still sophomore')
Permission-giving language ('Feel free to...', 'Does that sound good?')
Empowerment ('You've got it totally within your reach', 'This is all about you')

parent_management.response: Polite interruption: 'I'm gonna step in here... is this something YOU would be interested in?'
parent_management.technique: Redirect to student voice, explain why student opinion matters

parent_management.response: Validated concern, reframed as teachable moment about self-advocacy
parent_management.technique: Transform abstract worry into specific student task

parent_management.response: Let parent provide context, then re-asked student directly
parent_management.technique: Use parent info as springboard, circle back to student

rapid_research_during_session: Looked up Seattle Rose Society live
Showed real-time resource matching, not pre-scripted

immediate_week_1.action: Send email to counselor requesting AP Physics 2
immediate_week_1.quote: Send this email on Monday morning. Ask them to bump you to physics, too

short_term_3_months_fall: Join/explore robotics team (FRC season starts January)
Science fair project start (district fairs November)
Begin Seattle Rose Society volunteering exploration

tier_3_depth: Choose 1-2 main projects to go deep
tier_5_leadership: By junior year, clear leadership roles

meta_coaching_moments.lor_strategy: One thing that I would keep in mind this year is... try to get closer with teachers because you need, you're gonna start needing a lot of letters of recommendations
meta_coaching_moments.impact_vs_hours: The goal here is to not like necessarily push through a hierarchy... rather like create opportunities, are a good fit for you where you can immediately step into leadership roles
meta_coaching_moments.differentiation_through_authenticity: the only way to win this game is you, be you. UBU... do not try to fake
meta_coaching_moments.qualitative_vs_quantitative: What is the main difference in getting into... elite schools is a subjectivity. It's not objectivity
meta_coaching_moments.why_ivy_schools_matter: Why is Iv important? Is it gives you that mindset of future leaders of the world

proprietary_frameworks: Overcoming Adversity = 4/5 rubric weight (vs Special Talents = 3/5)
geographic_resource_arbitrage: NVIDIA robotics lab in Seattle (just opened)
Can't be Googled effectively - requires local knowledge
strategic_activity_elimination: Actively discouraged prestigious robotics due to personality/time fit
Willingness to say NO to 'good' opportunities that are wrong fit
medical_intervention_suggestion: When student said tired: 'Get blood test for vitamin D, iron, thyroid'
Not 'manage time better' - recognized physical health component
micro_tactical_scripts: 'Ask teachers about their academic background during passing periods' (specific for introverts)
'Ask 1-2 friends to join robotics team for buddy system' (addresses male-dominated environment)
parent_education_framework: Extensive education about US vs Indian system differences

discovery_questions: How do you feel about that? Has school already started?
Would you say, like, how do you feel about your relationship with your teachers?
What do you like about it?
What do you catch yourself thinking about the most?
What are you reading right now? Any recommendations?
narrative_questions: What about stem, or what specific aspect of stem you're interested in. And how did you gain that interest?
What do you like about it? [repeated for different activities]
Is this something that you would be interested in? Or is this something that you wouldn't find enjoyable at all?
What's an example of something that you've written?
How what got you into that? [re: chess]
Tell me a bit about Karate, and how long you've been involved
Do you see yourself like studying computer science in college? Or are there other subjects that you're still exploring?
Could you tell me a bit about like what you're interested in outside of school. It could be anything.
strategy_questions: Have you explored any research before?
Have you done any hackathons at all?
Do you plan to get more involved this year?
Would you be interested in starting your own club?
Is this something that sounds interesting to you like learning how to make robots move like humans?
execution_questions: How long have you been working there?
How long have you been doing that for?
How long ago did you send that message to your counselor?
Do you have a rating in chess?

for_high_achieving_introverted_explorer.lead_with: Structured questions about academics/activities before personal interests
for_high_achieving_introverted_explorer.emphasize: Small-group deep-impact activities over large clubs
for_high_achieving_introverted_explorer.avoid: Pressure for immediate enthusiasm, high-energy rah-rah language
key_deliverables: Written reflection prompts before live session
for_high_achieving_introverted_explorer.discovery_approach: Build gradually from factual to personal; save emotional questions for later
for_high_achieving_introverted_explorer.question_sequencing: Early: academics, school, activities; Mid: why behind activities; Late: dreams, concerns, personal interests

sections: Part 4: Target Ideal Extracurricular Profile (11 categories)
gameplan_structure_observed.tone: Professional but encouraging; specific but not overwhelming

medium_concrete.join_robotics: Binary membership but no role specified

differences: Different unique differentiators (gardening vs music/state choir)
framework_differences: Anoushka got 'Woman in STEM' positioning (not emphasized for Ananyaa)
Ananyaa got 'Overcoming Adversity' heavily (not for Anoushka)
Anoushka got 'Free=Prestigious' summer (Ananyaa's summers deferred to Session 2)
